meanings.definition: A representation of a person or thing, typically on a smaller scale.
meanings.sent1: The toy store had many models of cars for sale.
meanings.sent2: She is a fashion model who walks the runway.
meanings.sent3: The tiny model of the Eiffel Tower made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His detailed model of the solar system amazed the science fair judges.
meanings.sent5: The artist's clay model of a dinosaur looked incredibly realistic.

meanings.definition: A person employed to display clothes by wearing them.
meanings.sent1: The fashion show featured models in elegant dresses.
meanings.sent2: She became a successful model after being discovered at a mall.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy model accidentally tripped on the catwalk.
meanings.sent4: She was the perfect model for the designer's new collection.
meanings.sent5: The model confidently strutted down the runway, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A simplified description, especially a mathematical one, of a system or process.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used a model to explain the concept of fractions.
meanings.sent2: The scientist created a model to predict the weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The math model made solving the problem much easier.
meanings.sent4: Her model of the water cycle was both informative and creative.
meanings.sent5: The model of the human brain helped students understand its functions better.
